TopicTitle: What mod would you recommend me?

Articles.Content:
I am looking for some great mods out there but it's hard to choose. What kind of mod do would you recommend me?

I am not looking for Extra planets mods.

Anyone?

ok nvm imma just search some info on yt

Can you be a little more specific about what kind of mods you think you might like?  Also, what mods are you currently using?
 

Edited October 24, 2017 by OhioBob

CKAN makes it relatively easy to discover mods. You can have it only show you compatible mods. Each one includes a short description and a link to the forum page. Click through them, read up and decide if you want to try it.

kerbalkrashsystem is a pretty good one it adds crumple effect when colliding with the ground other rockets etc and it also adds damage so when a part takes damage it will malfunction with engines they will overheat really fast until repaired

with command pods some hatches will stop working until repaired

and fuel tanks will leak again until repaired

and bd armory is pretty good when you want to vent you frustration of a failed mission on the kerbals

Hmmm. 

What great mods you're looking for would depend on your skill level. If you are a new player I don't think you'd have much use for an advanced colonization mod. But anyways, I'd suggest...

Docking Port Alignment

Kerbal Engineer

...to get you started.

After a person got some experience and knew up from down I'd suggest getting the Umbra Space Industries stuff to expand their world and challenge. The Colonization and Life Support stuff for sure. Link.

https://umbraspaceindustries.github.io/UmbraSpaceIndustries/

I'm new and this is what I've been using.

I also have some strobes and lights but that's mostly 4 eye candy I like. I'd say you should get Chatterer too, as it seems to add a lot of good flavor to the game for everyone.

Edited October 24, 2017 by Kerbal7

Here is my mod list

I'ld say that for physics, FAR is essential. And I started playing with Principia and I am starting to think it is too. It might just need some adjustments but it works great and it's much interesting when playing around with strange orbits. It's more realistic too.
For graphis, it depends on your computer. I use a performance friendly setup, but manage to have clouds and scatterer water. It just depends on your GPU basically. It can look really good.

Then most of my other mods add gameplay mechanichs, and a few parts mods that are unnecesary really. Kas and Kis I will allways have it installed. Tweak Scale loved.

For the editor buildings, you might want to install RCSBuildAid, EditorExtensionsRedux, DefaultActionGroups.... for sure.
I think all my folder is essential really. LOL

Edited October 24, 2017 by Agustin
